description.narrative: Community Technology Empowerment Network (CTEN) is a refugee-founded and led organization which began in 2016 as community-based initiative in Rhino Camp refugee settlement West Nile region in Arua. It is Information and Communication Technology (ICT) centred organization whose main objective is to connect, assist and inform the refugees and host community through Information and Communication Technology. In 2018, CTEN became a legally registered NGO in Uganda headquartered at Eden Zone in Rhino Camp Refugee Settlement and has this year expanded to Rhino Camp, Imvepi, Bidibidi, Lobule and Kiryandongo settlements. Currently CTEN is part of emergency response in Zombo where over 3,000 refugees crossed from DR Congo Congo, taking led on COVID-19 risk communication and community engagement. Our experienced work force is comprised of 60% refugees and 40% non-refugees including host community members, international and national interns and or volunteers.

participating-org.narrative: Community Technology Empowerment Network (CTEN) is a refugee-founded and led organization which began in 2016 as community-based initiative in Rhino Camp refugee settlement West Nile region in Arua. It is Information and Communication Technology (ICT) centred organization whose main objective is to connect, assist and inform the refugees and host community through Information and Communication Technology. In 2018, CTEN became a legally registered NGO in Uganda headquartered at Eden Zone in Rhino Camp Refugee Settlement and has this year expanded to Rhino Camp, Imvepi, Bidibidi, Lobule and Kiryandongo settlements. Currently CTEN is part of emergency response in Zombo where over 3,000 refugees crossed from DR Congo Congo, taking led on COVID-19 risk communication and community engagement. Our experienced work force is comprised of 60% refugees and 40% non-refugees including host community members, international and national interns and or volunteers. Vision: Healthy, Informed and Peaceful Community Mission Strives to provide comprehensiveinformation and communication technology (ICT) and sports services to empower and transform communities to become productive and self-reliant. Values # Determination and commitment # Faithful # Inclusionof community values # Human Dignity # Transparent and accountable # Team work # Integrity Objectives # Promote peaceful coexistence in communities # Manage information dissemination in communities # Empower communities through digital literacy,tailoring skills and other capacity building initiatives # Establish and maintain sustainable Multipurpose Community Technology Centres (MCTCs) # Strengthen local institutions through provision of ICT infrastructure/services # Promote the use of ICT as a means of improving humanitarian service delivery # Assist in reconnecting separated refugee families with relatives within and or abroad # Engage communities in sports and other recreational activities

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
